result.execSummary:
The defendant Dwayne Lucas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.**
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.**
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwayne Lucas

Order for Prosecution Costs
Petition for Prosecution Costs
Summary of Itemized Statement of Other Prosecution Costs
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
of DNA Collection at Conviction

11:17 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dwayne Lucas in court, in custody.  Attorney David Patton in court for Dwayne Lucas. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM1053/22CM1110/22TR6117. Court appoints Attorney Patton to represent the DE in case 22CM1053 for today's hearing. Matter is resolved and agreement placed on the record.

22TR6117: On State's motion, case is dismissed.

22CM1110: On State's motion, case is dismissed.

22CM1053: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 1-3; found guilty by the court. 
Count 1: The court imposes sentence of 30 days jail; credit for 30 days served - TIME SERVED; $500 fine plus costs; pay $200 DNA surcharge; pay $65 prosecution costs (by stipulation of deft) - total amount owed $1,633 or 32 days KCJ - CREDIT for 32 days KCJ served (no amount owed); 12 month revocation of DL; OWI assessment.

Counts 2 & 3: Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. 10 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs, Drug surcharge and DNA surcharges ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.
Granting Defense Counsel's Motion to Withdraw

**AMENDED**
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphernalia  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  *Not To Discuss Case w/ DB, DJ, AM, May not operate motor vehicle w/ victims or have discussion of case w/ them.

1:47 PM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Seth Johnson. Clerk P. Scypta.  
MINUTES: Atty Johnson makes motion to withdraw due to an office-wide conflict. Motion granted. SPD to immediately reappoint. Court hears DE's pro se motion to modify bond to a lower amount. ST objects. Discussion held. Court modifies bond to $500 cash. All conditions remain as originally set.
filed by DE pro se
Proposed Order Granting Defense Counsel's Motion to Withdraw

122 PM   Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   The Court finds probable cause in this case today.   Substitution of Br. 2 filed.  Case assigned to Br. 6 pursuant to Court rule.   Plea of Not Guilty entered. Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am. $750  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). mi
